channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: TikTok sues federal government over free speech; U.S. pauses an Israel bomb shipment
item.description: TikTok is challenging a new law that would ban the app if it doesn't find a buyer, citing free speech supression. The U.S. paused a shipment of bombs to Israel over fears they could be used in Rafah.
item.content:encoded: TikTok is challenging a new law that would ban the app if it doesn't find a buyer, citing free speech supression. The U.S. paused a shipment of bombs to Israel over fears they could be used in Rafah.
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Venus and Earth used to look like 'twin' planets. What happened?
item.description: Earth, Mars and Venus all looked pretty similar when they first formed. Today, Mars is dry, cold, and dusty; Venus has a hot, crushing atmosphere. Why did these sibling planets turn out so different?
item.content:encoded: Earth, Mars and Venus all looked pretty similar when they first formed. Today, Mars is dry, cold, and dusty; Venus has a hot, crushing atmosphere. Why did these sibling planets turn out so different?
item.dc:creator: Regina G. Barber

item.title: Latino voter turnout is growing in Arizona. Senate hopefuls are trying to win support
item.description: Nearly 1 in 4 Arizona voters in the upcoming elections is expected to be Latino, according to recent projections by NALEO. But many say they are often overlooked by political campaigns.
item.content:encoded: Nearly 1 in 4 Arizona voters in the upcoming elections is expected to be Latino, according to recent projections by NALEO. But many say they are often overlooked by political campaigns.
item.dc:creator: Ben Giles

item.title: The Eurovision Song Contest kicked off with pop and protests
item.description: Performers representing countries across Europe and beyond took the stage in the first of two Eurovision semifinals in the Swedish city of Malmo, against a backdrop of both parties and protests.
item.content:encoded:
Performers representing countries across Europe and beyond took the stage in the first of two Eurovision semifinals in the Swedish city of Malmo, against a backdrop of both parties and protests.

(Image credit: Martin Meissner)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Students and civil rights groups blast police response to campus protests
item.description: Students say they suffered broken bones, concussions and other injuries from allegedly aggressive police action breaking up pro-Palestinian protests last week.
item.content:encoded:
Students say they suffered broken bones, concussions and other injuries from allegedly aggressive police action breaking up pro-Palestinian protests last week.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: The FDA misses its own deadline to propose a ban on formaldehyde from hair products
item.description: It is unclear why the suggested rule was not released by its intended deadline. But a spokesperson for the federal agency told NPR that its implementation "continues to be a high priority."
item.content:encoded: It is unclear why the suggested rule was not released by its intended deadline. But a spokesperson for the federal agency told NPR that its implementation "continues to be a high priority."
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Bipartisan congressional spouses tackle cancer prevention, and leave politics out
item.description: Lawmakers' spouses from both parties have worked to promote cancer awareness and prevention for more than 30 years. They stress the disease impacts families regardless of party and needs a spotlight.
item.content:encoded: Lawmakers' spouses from both parties have worked to promote cancer awareness and prevention for more than 30 years. They stress the disease impacts families regardless of party and needs a spotlight.
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: Migrant arrivals stretched Denver's budget. Now, the city is scaling back aid
item.description: In the last two years, Denver has seen more than 40,000 migrants arrive, many on buses chartered by Texas' governor.
item.content:encoded:
In the last two years, Denver has seen more than 40,000 migrants arrive, many on buses chartered by Texas' governor.

(Image credit: Kevin J. Beaty)
item.dc:creator: Kevin J. Beaty

item.title: Migrants claiming asylum can be allowed into the U.S. Here's how it works
item.description: Asylum rules in the U.S. paired with millions of cases backing up immigration courts are causing a major headache for the country.
item.content:encoded: Asylum rules in the U.S. paired with millions of cases backing up immigration courts are causing a major headache for the country.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trump's speeches follow a familiar playlist, featuring greatest hits among new tunes
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign speeches are like his signature rally playlists — never the same topics in the same order, heavy on the greatest hits but with room to riff on what's popular.
item.content:encoded:
Donald Trump's campaign speeches are like his signature rally playlists — never the same topics in the same order, heavy on the greatest hits but with room to riff on what's popular.

(Image credit: Nic Antaya)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
